{"step_by_step_thinking": "A condylar fracture that leads to disruption of the TMJ anteriorly is not a simple fracture, as it involves more than just a break in the bone. It's also not a compound fracture, as this term is typically used to describe a fracture where the bone pierces the skin. A comminuted fracture refers to a fracture in which the bone is shattered into many pieces. In this case, the fracture is complex because it involves not only the bone but also the joint, leading to a disruption of the TMJ.", "answer_choice": "C. Complex fracture"}
